results.title: Lamb for world market
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: A thriving industry in Western Australia is the production of lambs for the meat export trade. These lambs, which are slaughtered at 16 weeks, are specially bred for the purpose. They are yarded and sent to Fremantle. Great care is taken to prevent injury. After slaughtering, the carcases are carefully inspected, then graded and passed through various processes until they reach the freezing chamber. From there they are taken as expeditiously as possible to the ships which transport them to the United Kingdom, USA, Canada and Hong Kong.

results.title: Lalai dreamtime
results.creator_credit: Michael Edols and Australia Council. Aboriginal Arts Board
results.brief_description: Lalai Dreamtime is a reconstruction of the traditional way of Aboriginal life - in particular, the transmission of knowledge and culture from one generation to the next, enacted by the Woolagoodjah family of north-west Australia. An old man takes his son to a sacred place to explain about their ancestors. He outlines the foundation of Aboriginal mythology when humankind was prepared to accommodate to nature rather than change nature for the sake of humankind, and the fundamental and intimate connection between the Aboriginal people and their land. Esben Storm acted as editor on this multi-award winning film. With some Australian Aboriginal language with English subtitles.

results.title: Lake Maracaibo
results.creator_credit: Boris Woronzow, Unidad Filmica and Shell
results.brief_description: For centuries Lake Maracaibo, on the north-western coast of Venezuela, and the surrounding countryside have been the home of fishermen and shepherds. Today with the discovery of oil, swampland and savanna are being converted into industrial sites and residential districts.

results.title: Laila
results.creator_credit: Diane Beaudry, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Laila Paattinen is a working woman. Tired of low-paying jobs, she completed a five-month course in dry-wall installation. Because she had chosen a non-traditional job for women, she ran into resistance in the marketplace. She finally solved her problems by opening her own dry-wall application business. A useful film for women seeking non-traditional jobs.

results.title: Lahaul and Spiti
results.creator_credit: N.S. Thapa, Mohan Wadhwani and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: The mountains of Lahaul and Spiti are situated in the sparsely populated northern Punjab. Shows the people who live in the scattered towns and villages, their work, domestic life, festival and ceremonial dances. Buddhist monks live high in the mountains coming down on occasions to join with the villagers in religious ceremonies.
results.creator_credit_for_label: N.S. Thapa, Mohan Wadhwani and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Lagged: the story of a convict
results.creator_credit: Henrietta Clark, John Clark and NIDA
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a boy convicted as a pick- pocket in London in 1792 and transported to Botany Bay for seven years. Consists entirely of graphics from the period using sepia-tint photographs and contemporary ballads and suggests that a convict in Australia was better off than a coal miner in England, at least up to 1836. Historical adviser, A.T. Yarwood. Voices by John Krummel, Norman Hodges, Alan Edwards. Written by John and Henrietta Clark and filmed by George Pashuk.

results.title: Lagaan: Once upon a time in India [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Ashutosh Gowariker, Aamir Khan and Aamir Khan Productions
results.brief_description: A major cinematic event in India, and one of the most expensive films to ever come out of Bollywood, “Lagaan”, is about a group of impoverished villagers whose land is ravaged by drought. Fearing penury as a result of high taxes, Bhuvan (Indian star Aamir Khan) appeals the military governor for a repreive who challenges the locals to a game of cricket. Despite the fact that none can play the game, the farmers rally to save their homes. With its rousing musical numbers, “Lagaan” also boasts impressive cinematography and splendid performances. Nominated for Best Foreign Film, at the Academy Awards. Cast includes: Aamir Khan, Gracy Singh, Rachel Shelley, Paul Blackthorne, and Suhasini Mulay. In Hindi with English subtitles.

results.title: Ladyhawke [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Lauren Shuler, Warner Bros Pictures and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A haunting tale of magic and mysticism set in an age of enchantment and adventure. Navarre (Rutger Hauer) and Isabeau (Michelle Pfeiffer) are two lovers, condemned to spend eternity together - yet never to touch, due to the spell of that the corrupt Bishop Aquila has placed upon them. Aided by the young renegade thief, “Phillipe the mouse” (Matthew Broderick) and defrocked priest, Imperius (Leo McKern), they must find a moment in time when night and day are one - a time when evil will consume itself and the spell will be broken.
